msContents.summary: Nomination by Bernardino Torretano (written Bernardinus Turritanus in manuscript, archiepiscopal vicar representing Giovanni d'Andrea di Nanni Todeschini Piccolomini, archbishop of Siena), dated June 20 [?], 1511, appointing the priest Bernardino Matthei from the diocese of Grosseto to a rural chaplaincy. First word written in large display letters. Old repairs to holes along creases.

msItem.title: Archdiocese of Siena nomination
msItem.author: Catholic Church
Torretano, Bernardino
Piccolomini, Giovanni d'Andrea di Nanni Todeschini, 1475-1537

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Frederick North, Earl of Guilford, and Sir Thomas Phillipps (part of ms. 6067).

keywords.term: Clergy--Appointment, call, and election--Early works to 1800
